TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebPartConnectionCollection extends System.Collections.CollectionBase
Public NotInheritable Class WebPartConnectionCollection Inherits CollectionBase
public ref class WebPartConnectionCollection sealed : System::Collections::CollectionBase

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of connections for a control in a Web Parts zone. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A control in a Web Parts zone can act as a consumer of data from another control or as a provider of data to other controls. This class represents a collection of those connections. Typically, an instance of this class is returned from a property such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.Connections%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.StaticConnections%2A>. You can iterate through the collection in the same way you would any collection, and you can search for a particular connection using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection.ID%2A> property.

Docs.related: How to: Create a Static Connection Between Web Parts Controls

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection> collection. The object is added to the end of the collection. To add an object at a specific location in the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection.Insert%2A> method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method to determine whether a particular connection is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection> collection. This method is commonly used to test for the existence of a connection before performing a task, such as adding a connection to or removing one from a collection.

Docs.summary: Removes the specified object from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method to remove the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection> object from the collection. All items that follow the specified item are then moved up in the collection to fill in the vacant position. The indexes of the moved items are also updated. For more information, see <xref:System.Collections.IList.Remove%2A>.
